From: Robert Sartin <sartin@...>

So far, every time I have wanted something like assertNotEquals has
been when I am testing the equals method. Somehow, I actually like it
better to test the equals method using:

  assert(testObject.equals(shouldEqual));
  assert(!testObject.equals(shouldNotEqual));

rather than assertEquals and the proposed assertNotEquals.

I haven't (yet) encountered situations where I want to assert
inequality for other reasons.

Regards,

Rob

subject: Re: [junit] assertNotEquals
